page.title: 13PHEASANTS LITTLE OFFLEY
page.content: The farming at Little Offley is almost identical with the work done on the other farms we visited so we selected pheasant rearing as the topic to enquire about,which is a specific interest of the farmer.At the end of the shooting season he catches up a number of pheasants in the ratio of 20 hens to 3 cocks for the purpose of laying eggs from April onwards.The eggs are sent to a Game Farmer where they are incubated.They are returned to the farmer as one day chicks and kept in a warm draught-free enclosure within a stable.They are kept on an 'electric hen';which is a heated rectangular bed, evenly heated underneath and with a special lamp above.The positioning of the lamp is important;if it is too high the chicks will crowd together for warmth and risk suffocation.
